\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 54456}

\subsection*{Almost Like Hash Oil}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{stoner 1956}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   & smoked & Lactuca spp. & extract\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 220.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I extracted a tar like resin from wild lettuce by steeping the leaves in boiling hot watter 3 times, rincing between steepings. Each steep was 2 hours. Disgard the tea from this, soaked the leaves in Isopropyl alcohol in a hot attic for 3 days, evaporated the alcohol in a glass pie pan with a very small fan. What I get from this is a dark green tar that (1/2 a match head size ball) smokes like hash oil and hits the head almost as hard as hash oil.

\end{document}
